title: If I charge a phone and turn it off, why does it eventually die? - Quora

response.answer_text: Batteries drain charge over time, even if not connected. That why Duracell and Energizer put date codes on the batteries that they sell. A phone battery, while installed, actually drains a tiny bit more energy out to the switch in order to be ready to start up the phone. As it does this drain constantly, in order to have the phone ready whenever someone decides to push the power button, the battery drains at a low constant rate. Eventually, the battery will deplete.

Q: If I charge a phone and turn it off, why does it eventually die?A: Because all batteries self discharge to some degree, the ions migrate back reducing the electric potential, your phone battery is no different.
